intro: Sabatia decandra, commonly known as the clustered pink, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant features erect, branching stems covered in fine hairs and produces clusters of pink to red flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Sabatia decandra thrives in open, disturbed habitats such as fields and roadsides.
